problems.q: Lena collects 18 stickers and gets 27 more from a friend. How many stickers does she have now?
A bakery sells 32 muffins in the morning and 19 more in the afternoon. How many muffins were sold in all?
A bus holds 24 kids when it leaves and 17 more board at the next stop. How many kids are on the bus?
A jar has 45 marbles. After giving away 6, a friend adds 12 more. How many marbles are in the jar now?
The library has 68 storybooks and orders 22 more. How many storybooks will it have total?
A farmer picks 35 apples on Monday and 28 on Tuesday. How many apples did the farmer pick in all?
A concert sold 74 tickets online and 18 at the door. How many tickets were sold?
Hikers start with 9 water bottles and pack 15 more before leaving. How many bottles do they bring?
A class plants 16 tulips and 14 daffodils. How many flowers did the class plant?
A coach brings 11 cones for practice and finds 7 more in the shed. How many cones are available?
Noah has 53 candies and eats 17. How many candies are left?
A store had 80 notebooks and sold 29 of them. How many notebooks remain?
A tank held 65 liters of water but 24 liters were used. How many liters remain?
A 42-kilometer trail has 18 kilometers completed. How many kilometers are left to finish?
A garden has 39 carrots, and rabbits nibble 8 of them. How many carrots are left?
A box held 96 crayons, but 23 fell out. How many crayons are still in the box?
A jar holds 70 coins and 34 are spent on snacks. How many coins are left?
A bus has 48 seats, and 35 are filled. How many seats are empty?
There are 55 swimmers in a pool. If 21 leave, how many swimmers remain?
A class has 27 students, but 5 are absent today. How many students are present?
There are 4 boxes with 7 oranges in each. How many oranges are there in total?
Nine shelves each hold 6 books. How many books are there altogether?
Twelve teams play 3 games each. How many games are played in total?
For 8 weeks, there are 5 practice sessions each week. How many sessions is that?
There are 11 tables with 4 chairs at each. How many chairs are there?
Six trays carry 9 cupcakes each. How many cupcakes are there?
Three buses each hold 12 students. How many students can the buses carry?
Ten pitchers each hold 8 cups of lemonade. How many cups of lemonade is that in all?
Five packs contain 11 markers each. How many markers are there total?
Seven bundles each have 6 flowers. How many flowers are there altogether?
Twelve bags each hold 2 bagels. How many bagels are there?
Two cartons each carry 12 eggs. How many eggs are there total?
Nine boxes each contain 4 puzzles. How many puzzles are there?
Six shelves display 7 trophies each. How many trophies are on display?
Four tables are set with 9 place settings each. How many place settings are there?
Eight teams have 3 coaches each. How many coaches are there in all?
Five wagons carry 10 pumpkins each. How many pumpkins are there?
Eleven posters are printed with 5 copies each. How many copies are printed?
Seven jars hold 8 cookies each. How many cookies are there?
Three crates each hold 12 watermelons. How many watermelons is that altogether?
Eighty-four balloons are split equally among 7 friends. How many balloons does each friend get?
Sixty-three stickers are packed into groups of 9. How many packs can be made?
Ninety-six pencils are sorted into boxes of 8. How many boxes are filled?
Seventy-two meters of ribbon are cut into 6 equal pieces. How long is each piece?
Fifty-five apples are packed into bags of 5. How many bags are needed?
Forty-five cupcakes are shared equally among 9 classmates. How many cupcakes does each get?
A reader finishes 108 pages, reading 12 pages per day. How many days did the reader spend?
Sixty beads are strung into necklaces of 10 beads each. How many necklaces are made?
Sixty-six chairs are arranged in 6 equal rows. How many chairs are in each row?
Forty-eight trading cards are split among 4 friends equally. How many cards does each friend get?
A bakery baked 14 pies, delivered 3, then baked 9 more. How many pies are there now?
A jar had 41 shells, and 16 were given away. How many shells remain?
A train carries 37 passengers, and 22 more board at the next station. How many passengers are on the train?
Twelve singers practice 4 songs each. How many songs are practiced in total?
A book has 81 pages left to read. If 9 pages are read each day, how many days will that take?
An account had $120 and $45 were spent. How much money is left?
Six bags hold 12 candies each. How many candies are there altogether?
A caf√© brewed 19 cups of coffee in the morning and 23 in the afternoon. How many cups is that in total?
Ninety-six cupcakes are arranged on 12 trays equally. How many cupcakes are on each tray?
A warehouse stored 88 boxes and shipped 57 of them. How many boxes remain?
Eleven cartons hold 6 bottles each. How many bottles are there total?
At an aquarium, visitors see 18 clownfish and then 27 angelfish. How many fish did they see?
Fifty-four tickets are split evenly among 6 booths. How many tickets does each booth have?
A tree had 64 leaves before 29 fell. How many leaves are left?
Seven packages each contain 11 batteries. How many batteries are there in all?
A team scored 24 points in the first half and 19 in the second. What was the total score?
Ninety meters of fabric are cut into 10 equal rolls. How long is each roll?
Nine classes create 8 art projects each. How many projects are there?
A pool holds 250 liters of water, and 95 liters are drained. How many liters remain?
A bookstore received 28 mystery books and 34 comics. How many books arrived?
Sixty chocolates are shared among 5 boxes equally. How many chocolates go in each box?
Ten gardeners plant 7 rows each. How many rows are planted?
A shelf held 73 magazines, and 18 were removed. How many remain?
A festival sold 46 cups of lemonade in the morning and 31 in the evening. How many cups were sold total?
Eighty-four seeds are planted equally in 12 pots. How many seeds go in each pot?
Four musicians practice 11 scales each. How many scales are practiced altogether?
A garage stored 58 bikes, and 22 were rented. How many bikes are left?
A chef mixed 12 berries into batter and then added 15 more. How many berries are in the batter now?
Seventy-eight emails are sorted into 6 folders equally. How many emails go in each folder?
Three friends buy 12 concert tickets each. How many tickets do they buy altogether?
A park has 25 ducks, and 17 more arrive at the pond. How many ducks are there now?
A box had 69 pieces of chalk, and 33 were used. How many pieces remain?
Ninety-nine pencils are packed 9 per box. How many boxes are filled?
Eight classrooms have 9 laptops each. How many laptops are there total?
A water tank held 180 liters and leaked 45 liters. How many liters are left?
A farmer plants 14 rows of carrots and 18 rows of beans. How many rows are planted?
One hundred eight beads are split into 9 bracelets equally. How many beads are on each bracelet?
Twelve bundles carry 5 newspapers each. How many newspapers are there total?
A shelf held 44 plates, and 19 were removed. How many plates remain?
A museum welcomed 57 visitors in the morning and 26 in the afternoon. How many visitors came that day?
Forty-eight cookies are shared equally by 8 children. How many cookies does each child get?
Six painters use 7 brushes each. How many brushes are being used?
There were 95 pages to print, and 28 are already printed. How many pages remain?
A school has 36 basketballs and buys 17 more. How many basketballs does the school have now?
Seventy-two berries are sorted into 9 jars equally. How many berries go in each jar?
Five stacks hold 12 books each. How many books are there altogether?
A train has 130 seats, and 47 are occupied. How many seats are empty?
A parade has 22 floats and 19 marching bands. How many groups are in the parade?
Eighty-four pencils are shared equally by 12 artists. How many pencils does each artist receive?
Nine crates each hold 6 melons. How many melons are there altogether?
